intro: Psychotria chiococcoides, commonly known as the red psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are a key feature of its appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
